## Description {#details}

The string table used for serializing remarks.

This table can be for example serialized in a section to be consumed after the compilation.

Definition at line 36 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/remarks/remarkstringtable-h">RemarkStringTable.h</a>.

### internalize() {#a3f58ed47dc2581869528b5478cd04ded}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void StringTable::internalize (<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/remarks/remark">Remark</a> &amp; R)</>}>
Modify <code>R</code> to use strings from this string table.

If the string table does not contain the strings, it adds them.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/remarks/remarkstringtable-h/#l00059">59</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/remarks/remarkstringtable-h">RemarkStringTable.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/remarks/remarkstringtable-cpp/#l00041">41</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/remarks/remarkstringtable-cpp">RemarkStringTable.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### serialize() {#a78e58ea3fcbfd1e8b4a5921c850507a0}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void StringTable::serialize (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/raw-ostream">raw&#95;ostream</a> &amp; OS) const</>}>
Serialize the string table to a stream.

It is serialized as a little endian uint64 (the size of the table in bytes) followed by a sequence of NULL-terminated strings, where the N-th string is the string with the <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#abdf8cf606905c10634e831390981b0ed">ID</a> N in the StrTab map.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/remarks/remarkstringtable-h/#l00064">64</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/remarks/remarkstringtable-h">RemarkStringTable.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/remarks/remarkstringtable-cpp/#l00056">56</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/remarks/remarkstringtable-cpp">RemarkStringTable.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### serialize() {#a2b58d23a2b774b24b57b6207440887af}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>std::vector&lt; StringRef &gt; StringTable::serialize () const</>}>
Serialize the string table to a vector.

This allows users to do the actual writing to file/memory/other. The string with the <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#abdf8cf606905c10634e831390981b0ed">ID</a> == N should be the N-th element in the vector.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/remarks/remarkstringtable-h/#l00068">68</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/remarks/remarkstringtable-h">RemarkStringTable.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/remarks/remarkstringtable-cpp/#l00065">65</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/remarks/remarkstringtable-cpp">RemarkStringTable.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>

### StrTab {#a6b9ea0ddb6059ba10219d79eee49ea4a}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>StringMap&lt;unsigned, BumpPtrAllocator&gt; llvm::remarks::StringTable::StrTab</>}>
The string table containing all the unique strings used in the output.

It maps a string to an unique <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#abdf8cf606905c10634e831390981b0ed">ID</a>.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/remarks/remarkstringtable-h/#l00039">39</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/remarks/remarkstringtable-h">RemarkStringTable.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
